metadata.title: CVE-2022-49032 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:iio: health: afe4404: Fix oob read in afe4404_[read|write]_rawKASAN report out-of-bounds read as follows:BUG: KASAN: global-out-of-bounds in afe4404_read_raw+0x2ce/0x380Read of size 4 at addr ffffffffc00e4658 by task cat/278Call Trace: afe4404_read_raw iio_read_channel_info dev_attr_showThe buggy address belongs to the variable: afe4404_channel_leds+0x18/0xffffffffffffe9c0This issue can be reproduce by singe command: $ cat /sys/bus/i2c/devices/0-0058/iio\:device0/in_intensity6_rawThe array size of afe4404_channel_leds and afe4404_channel_offdacsare less than channels, so access with chan->address cause OOB readin afe4404_[read|write]_raw. Fix it by moving access before use them.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-49032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
